name: padijun
text: Little known fact: Robert Johnson sold his soul to the devil not for blues skills, but for bugging out eyes

name: doctorother
text: Ray is, as always, a true hoot and a holler.  If I ever get a chance to go back in time, I will go ask Robert Johnson if he can indeed do this.

name: afastidioushat
text: Of course Robert Johnson could do this. He would use this trick most often to turn a phrase just by staring at it.

name: greyfield
text: What makes this strip amusing is that it's one of the few strips that reminds me of the fact that Ray is, indeed, a cat (note his eyes in the 7th panel), along with the leaping episode in GOF.

name: cracklewater
text:
Isn't this about the only time we ever see Ray's eyes?

His glasses are lifted on one other occasion but, of course, he's sold his eyes.

name: griffypoo
text: Or you could just die and go to hell.  Seems like the easier way to meet him, if the comic is to be believed.

name: afillak
text: A comment left by afillak was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Fuyukodachi, joeyramoney, apocowarg, fakead, Gompo, TwoRightFeet, getawaykettle, Bex, trisha, NDCaesar, woodenteeth, SoManyWhales, nipsy43, Magb, therealsnazzle, mystkmanat, Zem, Wulvaine, gorrioncita, Xaxx)

name: speth
text: if people dont stop doing that adjective. noun. EVARRR routine im gonna get an ulcer

name: woodenteeth
text: You must have some pretty heavy internal bleeding by now... as 4chan lives so will you have gastrointestinal difficulties.

name: hexjumper
text:
Notice that he's got the same lack of punctuation as Roast Beef?

If we can get a tape recording of him speaking, then we'd have a better idea of how Beef speaks. Although "a soft, semi-monotone" would probably fit the bill.

name: spinynorman
text: I'm just going to come in here and say his version of St. James' Infirmary is utterly fantastic.

name: radarjammer
text: Look at his Stop Breaking Down blues on youtube. He did sell his soul.

name: poodlelucy
text: yesssss. st james infirmary is the blues is in it's most quintessential form. that song speaks to me. also noteworthy: the bobby "blue" bland version.

name: shutup_shutup
text: I'm going to have to disagree, since St. James is not strictly a blues (ie twelve-bar).  For more such pedantry just listen to Steve Buscemi talk in Ghost World.

name: fattypneumonia
text: Chubby for Bobby Bland reference.  Just, everybody go download "Two Steps from the Blues" right now.

name: wite_rabit
text: I hear his voice as a sort of sad Morgan Freeman.

name: nice-on-water
text: If his speaking was anything like his singing, then it's somewhat whiny, nasally, gritty, and droning in a way that gives you shivers from HELL.

name: overmedicated
text: Am I right in thinking this is the only time we see Ray's actualy eyes?

name: biddlebubbly
text: There's the strip where you see his sewn-up eye sockets but I think you're right on the eyeballs.

name: xerol
text: I would assume he bought them back at some point after becoming rich.

name: senseihollywood
text: it's on the  level such as when we finally see Jake Blues' eyes that one and only time in the Blues Brothers...matter of fact there's hell of lot of parallels twixt Jake and Ray...

name: godfatherofsouls
text: And Beef seems like a dry white toast kinda guy.

name: professorhazard
text: Guinness, bread, and butter.

name: overmedicated
text: goodnight

name: djwhiterabbit
text: i was just scrolling down to see if anyone else had already said what i was thinking.

name: gompo
text: He looks really vulnerable and hopeful that Robert Johnson will approve.  Having eyes is a strange thing for Ray.

name: harveymersault
text: And Johnson is one of the only humans we see in entirety.

name: saint
text: A comment left by saint was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Connellingus, farqussus, nutmeg, perhapsmaybe, SenseiHollywood, Dainbramage, Carten)

name: huber
text: yeah, that is quite an honour - it could make Ray the coolest cat of all time

name: mrsmuckles
text: Able to rival the likes of Nightlife Mingus himself.

name: cuddlefish
text: totally enrolling in the Robert Johnson School of Ocular Shenanigans

name: epicurus
text: 5/5 because the way Johnson's speech is qritten I can tell exactly what he sounds like. Even the Captial "C" in "closed".

name: ocarina654
text:
Feel the same way.
I didn't read Johnson, I HEARD Johnson.

name: epicurus
text: It's so true. It really is pretty awesome how well this comic is done. Like, I will totally take the balls out of my mouth in a second, but seriously guys, really, for real.

name: johnnyc
text: I WILL TELL YOU WHEN YOU CAN TAKE THE BALLS OUT OF YOUR MOUTH

name: yingkaixing
text: Chubbied for avatar/comment synergy.

name: mugi
text: Hearing Klink say that is...creepy.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Robert Johnson is such a jovial fellow for a Blues singer.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
He is not a jovial fellow. He is a Blues sinner. It is a miraculous thing that Ray makes him smile.

This was noticed in Heav....Hebbin.

name: rogergs
text: Luminous cat eyes are made for that stunt.

name: cdl146
text: Apparently Ray got his eyes back when he died.

name: cailetshadow
text: They were in the glove compartment of the Subaru Brat, in a little carrying case along with some eyedrops.

name: ovenface
text: what do you think this is, heaven? they were actually sitting in a bag of sand.

name: cailetshadow
text:
Onstad's heaven isn't all that different from his hell. Hell has mellow jazz musicians and fried chicken, and heaven has Trouble Man and No-No, and a really terrible music selection.

Bottom line, try to stay alive, but no big deal if you can't.

name: ovenface
text: I suppose you are correct, really.

name: tellumo
text: WHOA. You did not call Robert Frickin' Johnson a "mellow jazz musician." You did not just do that.

name: cailetshadow
text: for the record, i meant mellow (jazz musician), not (mellow jazz) musician. And I don't know how mellow he was in life, I'm just commenting on his attitude in the comic. Maybe Hell has a way of mellowing a man.

name: deusoma
text: I like the way you clarified that. Have a chubby.

name: laserblade
text: He was a bluesman.  He predated jazz by a few years.

name: nice-on-water
text: The blues influenced jazz alongside it.  They grew up together like two li'l grade school misfits, jazz always kicking around in the creek behind the baseball field, blues all looking for snakes and turtles in the tall grass...

name: scorpio_nadir
text: That is the purpose of Purgatory. To mellow the soul of  a Man. Rbt. Jhnsn was not a mellow man.

name: idsyen
text: "Try to stay alive, but no big deal if you can't." I think I am going to make this my new ethos. This is a wonderful way to look at things.

name: allenphreak
text: Looks like you were lamed by the only fan of the Charlie Rose show circa 1989.

name: atticusonline
text: That cat is cold staring down that man.

name: tttt
text: everybody from the past loves Ray

name: molesticide
text:
everybody in the past loves ray because he is from history.

i love how amused robert johnson is by the trick ray pulls, which robert johnson moments ago taught ray how to do.

name: epicurus
text: Ray had the best possible reaction to Johnson's trick.

name: mountaindewtab
text: ray has eyes!

name: drskradley
text: The comic that got me hooked.

name: quantumcasaba
text:
With his eyes like that, I want to scratch Ray on the head and open a can of tuna for him.
"Woah man! Don't scratch my head! What the hell, man?"
So it is good that his eyes are usually obscured.
(I love this arc, too.)

name: ashoykh
text:
Robert Johnson died of Strychnine poisoning. It was well known that he would drink anything given to him at the bar, despite the better advice of friends like Charlie Patton. It was also well-known that he slept with lots of women - some of whom had husbands. In the end, somebody slipped him a Rat poison cocktail.

Ten to twenty minutes after exposure, the body's muscles begin to spasm, starting with the head and neck. The spasms then spread to every muscle in the body, with nearly continuous convulsions, and get worse at the slightest stimulus. The convulsions progress, increasing in intensity and frequency until the backbone arches continually. Death comes from asphyxiation caused by paralysis of the neural pathways that control breathing, or by exhaustion from the convulsions. The subject will die within 2%u20133 hours after exposure. At the point of death, the body "freezes" immediately, even in the middle of a convulsion, resulting in instantaneous rigor mortis. (wikipedia)

name: ovenface
text: wow. that is terrible.

name: heccibiggs
text: Fuck.

name: deusoma
text: Robert Johnson died like that ? Damn man. Now that is the Saddest Thing.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
That is regarded as urban legend. Strychnine is extremely bitter according to toxicologists and is fatal within hours, not days.
In the 70's, it was allegedly used in minute quantities to give some LSD batches a boost. I know this.

name: cracklewater
text:
I think that's an urban legend, same as the one about LSD 'breaking down' into strychnine when old or maltreated (or that strychnine is used as a catalyst in the production of acid).

I read in a few places that no amount of strychnine has ever been found in tested/seized LSD.

name: nice-on-water
text: No man, that's the blues.

name: luckypyjamas
text: GAAAAAAAAAH HE GOT HIS EYES BAAAAAAAAACK

name: nucleargeranium
text: Daaaamn. I thought Ray sold his eyes.

name: caddon
text: That capital C gives 'Closed' a whole new level of meaning. It's a Thing.

name: saddestking
text: The background, lightening up gradually, is actually Ray's Friendship Meter

name: tripleg
text: i feel this comment needs more chubbies

name: skaterpix
text: can't you SEE?

name: doubleclef
text: Debunking the myth of Ray not having eyes.

name: arielle88
text: His eyes come back when he dies. He is in Hell, the same laws don't apply...

name: carlyle
text: I thought he sold those eyes.

name: woodenteeth
text: Congratulations! You are the 1000th cust - person to make the same god damned comment!

name: carlyle
text: I'm just as disappointed in myself as you are disappointed in my comment.

name: woodenteeth
text: I'm not that disappointed really. I do like expunging accumulated anger from real life in an anonymous forum though. Hands up who gets road rage!

name: gigs
text:
...huh, apparently my old computer couldn't display Robert Johnson in all his glory, and he came out as the same color of black as the background, so I thought all that was there was the eyes.

Needless to say, I got freaked the fuck out when I saw this strip on a better computer.

name: lucobrazzi88
text: i am going to pistol whip the next alt text that says shenanigans!

name: greenkoolayd
text: [IMGS OFF]
